author: Bahá'u'lláh
source_text: كَ وَمُؤانِسَ مَطْلَعِ ذاتِكَ وَفَرَّقَتْهُمْ أَرْياحُ مَشِيَّتِكَ إِلى أَنْ أَدْخَلَتْهُمْ فِي ظِلِّكَ وَجِوارِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ لَمَّا أَسْكَنْتَهُمْ فِي ظِلِّ قِبابِ رحْمَتِكَ وَفِّقْهُمْ عَلَى ما يَنْبَغِي لِهذَا الْمَقامِ الأَسْنی، أَيْ رَبِّ لا تَجْعَلْهُمْ مِنَ الَّذِينَ فِي القُرْبِ مُنِعُوا عَنْ زيارَةِ طَلْعَتِكَ وَفِي الوِصالِ جُعِلُوا مَحْرُومًا عَنْ لِقائِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ هؤُلآءِ عِبَادٌ دَخَلُوا مَعَكَ فِي هذا السِّجْنِ الأَعْظَمِ وَصَامُوا فِيهِ بِما أَمَرْتَهُمْ فِي أَل
translation: These are the ones, O my God, whom Thou hast graciously enabled to have fellowship with Thee and to commune with Him Who is the Revealer of Thyself. The winds of Thy will have scattered them abroad until Thou didst gather them together beneath Thy shadow, and didst cause them to enter into the precincts of Thy court. Now that Thou hast made them to abide under the shade of the canopy of Thy mercy, do Thou assist them to attain what must befit so august a station. Suffer them not, O my Lord, to be numbered with them who, though enjoying near access to Thee, have been kept back from recognizing Thy face, and who, though meeting with Thee, are deprived of Thy presence.

terms.note: Root ش-ي-ء commonly rendered 'nothingness,' 'transitory things,' 'earthly things' across 41 occurrences. 'Thy will' here emphasizes divine purpose rather than phenomenal emptiness.
Root و-ص-ل yields 'cup of reunion,' 'nectar of reunion,' 'ocean of My presence' (6 occ.). 'Meeting with Thee' here opts for directness, avoiding the ecstatic imagery of 'reunion' or 'nectar.'
